info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 5 at 2:20PM CDT until July 5 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bexar and Comal.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, Canyon Lake, Fair Oaks Ranch, Bulverde, Hollywood Park, Cross Mountain, Timberwood Park, Bergheim, Guadalupe River State Park, Spring Branch, Smithson Valley, The Dominion, Leon Springs, Hill Country Village, Specht Store, Anhalt, Honey Creek State Natural Area and Scenic Oaks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
